sentences.en: a dim glow
sentences.cn: 昏暗的微光

sentences.en: Alistair saw the dim figure of Rose in the chair.
sentences.cn: 阿利斯泰尔看见了坐在椅子里的罗丝的模糊身影。

sentences.en: Below decks, the lights were dim.
sentences.cn: 船舱里灯光昏暗。

sentences.en: Dim your lights behind that car.
sentences.cn: 开到那辆车后面时将前灯调为近光。

sentences.en: Even in the dim light the equipment looked old and time-worn.
sentences.cn: 即便在昏暗的光线下，那台设备也显得陈旧不堪。

sentences.en: His punishing schedule seemed to dim his fire at times.
sentences.cn: 繁忙的日程似乎有时让他精力不济。

sentences.en: I could see a dim shape in the doorway.
sentences.cn: 我模模糊糊看见门口有个人影。

sentences.en: I made out two dim shapes in my dream.
sentences.cn: 我在梦中看到有两个模糊的影子.

sentences.en: in the dim light of the early dawn
sentences.cn: 在微弱的晨曦里

sentences.en: Martha managed to produce a dim, watery smile.
sentences.cn: 玛莎勉强挤出一丝笑容。

sentences.en: Once , in the dim and distant past, I live in here.
sentences.cn: 我很久以前在这里住过.

sentences.en: Pete's torch picked out the dim figures of Bob and Chang.
sentences.cn: 皮特的火把映出了鲍勃和张的模糊身影。

sentences.en: Some people are rather dim about the purposes of their lives.
sentences.cn: 有些人稀里糊涂,不知他们生活的目的是什么.

sentences.en: the dim glow of the fire in the grate
sentences.cn: 壁炉里微弱的火光

sentences.en: The light is too dim for me to read easily.
sentences.cn: 光线太暗,我很难阅读.

sentences.en: The lights in the theatre began to dim.
sentences.cn: 剧院里的灯光开始暗下来。

sentences.en: The outline of the mountain in the distance is dim.
sentences.cn: 远处山脉的轮廓隐隐约约.

sentences.en: The room was dim and cool and quiet.
sentences.cn: 房间里阴暗、清冷，静悄悄的。

sentences.en: Their economic prospects have dimmed.
sentences.cn: 他们的经济前景变得暗淡了。

sentences.en: They took a dim view of local trade unionists.
sentences.cn: 他们对当地的工会会员们评价很低。

sentences.en: You can be really dim sometimes!
sentences.cn: 有时候你可真笨啊！

words.tran_cn: [车辆] 调光器；光暗掣；衰减器
使暗淡；变模糊（dim的过去式）
使暗淡，使失去光泽；使变模糊

trans.tran_cn: 昏暗的，模糊的，渺茫的，迟钝的
trans.tran_en: fairly dark or not giving much light, so that you cannot see well

trans.tran_cn: （使）变昏暗，变模糊，变渺茫，（使）减弱，淡化
trans.tran_en: if a light dims, or if you dim it, it becomes less bright
